introduction.p: Severity measures impact of the bug on the system under test not considering user perspective.

guidelines.p: If the severity is not indicated in the bug pattern, here are some guidelines to identify the severity level of a bug:

ul.li: Assign 1 "Fatal" if the program crashes or data is lost or corrupted or there is a safety-related failure
Assign 2 "Severe" if the program fails to meet the specifications in a way that affects a user's ability to get work done and there is no reasonable workaround
Assign 3 "Minor" if the program fails to meet specifications in a less significant way
